entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/Aircraft
entry.value: Basilikon Archaeoptera

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/AircraftDescription
entry.value: Edifício que produz aeronaves e gera comida, minério e influência.

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/AircraftFlavor
entry.value: Uma Archaeoptera é apenas mais uma instalação de construção do Adeptus Mechanicus, embora para máquinas voadoras ao invés de terrestres. Possui todos os elementos usuais—a mão de obra escrava em massa para construir as máquinas, as instalações médicas para todas as amputações que os pilotos precisam para se encaixar, e os santuários para conduzir os rituais apropriados sobre os Transvectors e Stratoraptors. Em outras palavras, um manufactorum de Tech-Priest totalmente normal.

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/Construction
entry.value: Artisan Constructorum

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/ConstructionDescription
entry.value: Edifício que constrói novos edifícios e gera comida, minério e influência.

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/ConstructionFlavor
entry.value: O título simples de 'artesão' oculta a imensidão do que estes Tech-Priests conseguem. Não pessoalmente, é claro, mas através de vastas forças de trabalho de servitors com mente apagada. Aqui, no Constructorum, este exército de ex-homens constrói os edifícios e ferramentas para permitir os esforços dos Tech-Priests em outros lugares.

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/Energy
entry.value: Thermo-Exchanger Shrine

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/EnergyDescription
entry.value: Edifício que gera energia.

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/EnergyFlavor
entry.value: Após milênios de habitação, Gladius Prime é um tesouro de tecnologia antiga, muito ativa e incorporada profundamente em sua crosta. Além disso, o núcleo do planeta ainda está ativo com magma fervente. Os Thermo-Exchanger Shrines usam tecnologia arcana e ritual para explorar as agitações inquietas do planeta e reunir essa energia para uso em outros lugares.

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/Food
entry.value: Ferratonic Furnaces

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/FoodDescription
entry.value: Edifício que coleta comida.

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/FoodFlavor
entry.value: Os Adeptus Mechanicus não são famosos por seu amor aos prazeres da carne e é um Tech-Priest raro que admitiria ser um gourmet de qualquer coisa além de código. Isso é refletido nestas Ferratonic Furnaces reutilizadas, ou melhor, sua saída dietética. Suas rações são calibradas para serem o meio mais eficiente para transferir a energia e recursos mínimos absolutos para uma pessoa média sobreviver e funcionar.

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/Loyalty
entry.value: Protoservitor Cradle

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/LoyaltyDescription
entry.value: Edifício que aumenta a lealdade.

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/LoyaltyFlavor
entry.value: É claro, há dissidência no Imperium. Mesmo no Adeptus Mechanicus, conservador como é, há discordância sobre o melhor caminho a seguir. E toda essa é uma discórdia produtiva e útil. Pois se não houvesse hereges, não haveria as matérias-primas humanas necessárias para produzir servitors e servo-crânios, para servir como exemplos à humanidade covarde do que acontece àqueles que se desviam do Caminho do Omnissiah.

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/Headquarters
entry.value: Forge Temple

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/HeadquartersDescription
entry.value: Edifício do quartel-general que gera recursos.

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/HeadquartersFlavor
entry.value: O Forge Temple é o centro da presença do Adeptus Mechanicus em um mundo. É uma cidadela de informação, um repositório dos remanescentes do conhecimento há muito prezado pela humanidade... ou o quartel-general de um culto fanático dedicado a acumular informações que poderiam salvar a humanidade? Pensar no último seria, é claro, heresia...

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/HeroesDescription
entry.value: Edifício que produz sacerdotes técnicos, aumenta o limite populacional e a lealdade.

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/HeroesFlavor
entry.value: A Sub-Cloister serve como abrigo e escola para novos Tech-Priests. Aqui, acólitos promissores provenientes das cidades-colmeia do planeta são treinados em muitos segredos do Cult Mechanicus. Com o tempo — se sobreviverem — encontram sua vocação, surgindo como humildes Enginseers, fanáticos Electro-Priests, cibernéticos Data-Smiths ou qualquer uma de uma miríade de outras especializações não‑combatentes.

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/Housing
entry.value: Hab Fane

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/HousingDescription
entry.value: Edifício que aumenta o limite populacional.

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/HousingFlavor
entry.value: É difícil imaginar uma raça alienígena que aprovaria as condições de vida de um Mundo Colmeia — talvez os subterrâneos Hrud. Ainda assim, para o Adeptus Mechanicus, elas são ideais. Eles buscam replicar essa eficiência em seus próprios módulos habitacionais, espremendo trabalhadores, servitors e skitarii em aposentos tão apertados que a violência pareceria inevitável — não fosse pela engenharia comportamental e pela cirurgia.

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/Infantry
entry.value: Genetor Caropraedium

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/InfantryDescription
entry.value: Edifício que produz infantaria e gera comida, minério e influência.

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/InfantryFlavor
entry.value: Dizer que as academias de treinamento do Astra Militarum ‘produzem’ soldados ofenderia os centros lógicos de qualquer Tech-Priest. Mesmo o mais humilde acólito sabe que humanos são apenas uma das matérias‑primas na produção de soldados eficazes, com circuitos, bioplástico e metal compondo a maior parte da maioria dos Skitarii. Afinal, ‘a carne é falível’!

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/Influence
entry.value: Auto-Choral Transmitter

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/InfluenceDescription
entry.value: Edifício que gera influência.

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/InfluenceFlavor
entry.value: Para qualquer outra pessoa, é ruído de máquina — zumbidos, bipes e rangidos. Mas para os receptores de um sujeito do Adeptus Mechanicus aumentado, é uma combinação de canto coral vespertino, sinfonia elegante e fervorosa prece à glória do Omnissiah e à retidão de Seus servos, o Adeptus Mechanicus.

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/Ore
entry.value: Haemotrope Reactor

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/OreDescription
entry.value: Edifício que coleta minério.

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/OreFlavor
entry.value: Esta instalação complexa é plenamente compreendida por poucos Tech-Priests, mas pode ser reconfigurada para muitas funções. Na ausência de mão de obra do Adeptus Administratum para extrair fisicamente o minério, o Adeptus Mechanicus recorre a técnicas antigas aprovadas — redirecionando a saída de plasma do Reator para veios de minério a fim de extrair e refinar os metais que contêm.

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/Research
entry.value: Librarium Omnis

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/ResearchDescription
entry.value: Edifício que gera pesquisa.

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/ResearchFlavor
entry.value: Nomeado em homenagem ao repositório de dados que cobre continentes, enterrado sob a superfície de Marte, cada Librarium local contém uma pequena fração do conhecimento sobrevivente da humanidade, muito do qual foi desordenado ou corrompido durante o Cisma de Marte. Muitos Tech-Priests dedicam suas vidas (e as perdem) explorando esses segredos na esperança de redescobrir conhecimentos antigos ou mesmo — se o Omnissiah permitir — um STC.

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/Vehicles
entry.value: Manufactorum Cybernetica

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/VehiclesDescription
entry.value: Edifício que produz veículos terrestres e gera comida, minério e influência.

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/VehiclesFlavor
entry.value: Um manufactorum de Tech-Priest está léguas à frente de seu equivalente Imperial padrão. Não tecnologicamente, é claro — o Cult Mechanicus considera mais importante salvaguardar a tecnologia que possuem, e melhorá‑la é uma heresia Xenarita que só o próprio Cawl poderia considerar. Em vez disso, este edifício possui rituais, unguentos, cânticos, libações e afins superiores.

entry.name: AstraMilitarum/AircraftDescription
entry.value: Edifício que produz aeronaves e gera minério e influência.

entry.name: AstraMilitarum/AircraftFlavor
entry.value: Este campo de pouso foi projetado para naves maiores — quase em escala intra‑sistêmica — mas, com as intermináveis tempestades da Dobra, foi reaproveitado para abrigar as forças aéreas Imperiais. Semelhante a uma plataforma Skyshield, possui geradores de campo limitados para proteger aeronaves no solo de fogo inimigo.

entry.name: AstraMilitarum/Construction
entry.value: Labour Corps

entry.name: AstraMilitarum/ConstructionDescription
entry.value: Edifício que constrói novos edifícios e gera comida e pesquisa.

entry.name: AstraMilitarum/ConstructionFlavor
entry.value: Enquanto o Administratum administra todo o Império do Homem, o Departmento Munitorum é encarregado exclusivamente de fornecer mão de obra e suprimentos ao Astra Militarum. Entre suas muitas tarefas está a construção de grandes instalações, como aeródromos ou estações orbitais. Os pobres infantes que fazem o trabalho são o Labour Corps — trabalhadores contratados, penais e servitors com a mente apagada.

entry.name: AstraMilitarum/Energy
entry.value: Plasma Ioniser

entry.name: AstraMilitarum/EnergyDescription
entry.value: Edifício que gera energia.

entry.name: AstraMilitarum/EnergyFlavor
entry.value: Embora os antigos possam ter dividido o átomo, os Techpriests do Império tiveram milênios para aperfeiçoar os rituais pelos quais extraem energia. O Plasma Ioniser de núcleo aberto usa sistemas de infusão de resfriamento para manter uma saída em torno de 100 petawatts por até cem dias — cerca de 10.000 vezes a de uma maior usina de fissão histórica.

entry.name: AstraMilitarum/Food
entry.value: Soylens Farm

entry.name: AstraMilitarum/FoodDescription
entry.value: Edifício que coleta comida.

entry.name: AstraMilitarum/FoodFlavor
entry.value: Os soylens viridians podem ser substanciais, nutritivos e fáceis de cultivar em grandes cubas — mas, como alimento, têm alguns inconvenientes. Primeiro, são totalmente sem graça e sem sabor. Segundo, parecem uma papa verde. Terceiro, são feitos de qualquer matéria orgânica disponível. Rumores persistentes dizem que cadáveres humanos não são excluídos.

entry.name: AstraMilitarum/Loyalty
entry.value: Sanctum Imperialis

entry.name: AstraMilitarum/LoyaltyDescription
entry.value: Edifício que aumenta a lealdade.

entry.name: AstraMilitarum/LoyaltyFlavor
entry.value: A sede local do Culto Imperial pode parecer sombria e gótica, mas é, na verdade, um lugar sagrado. Adornada por estátuas de santos, é um símbolo local venerado da vontade divina do Imperador e fornece inspiração à população próxima.

entry.name: AstraMilitarum/Headquarters
entry.value: Basilica Administratum

entry.name: AstraMilitarum/HeadquartersDescription
entry.value: Edifício de quartel-general que gera recursos.

entry.name: AstraMilitarum/HeadquartersFlavor
entry.value: O edifício administrativo central de qualquer colônia Imperial, a magnífica Basílica é um templo à burocracia. Gerações de funcionários de roupas simples vivem e morrem entre tomos bamboleantes, decidindo o destino de sistemas estelares com o fraco estampido de seus carimbos. Como diz o ditado, a Inquisição pode queimá-lo, os Astartes podem fulminá-lo — mas só o Adeptus Administratum pode atormentá-lo por toda a sua vida.

entry.name: AstraMilitarum/Heroes
entry.value: Shrine of the Aquila

entry.name: AstraMilitarum/HeroesDescription
entry.value: Edifício que produz heróis, gera influência e aumenta a lealdade.

entry.name: AstraMilitarum/HeroesFlavor
entry.value: Muito mais que uma mera estátua, esta grande águia metálica foi fundida a partir dos restos derretidos de naves espaciais e serve de inspiração aos que a cercam. As tropas Imperiais que lutam sob a vigília incessante da Aquila encontram nova determinação em seus corações, sabendo que são os últimos de uma linhagem de heróis que se estende pelas estrelas.

entry.name: AstraMilitarum/Housing
entry.value: Hab Block

entry.name: AstraMilitarum/HousingDescription
entry.value: Edifício que aumenta o limite populacional.

entry.name: AstraMilitarum/HousingFlavor
entry.value: A clássica estrutura Imperial, esses edifícios padronizados são vistos por todo o Império. Eles fornecem o mínimo de abrigo e conforto necessário para que o povo do Imperium arraste suas curtas vidas. Na fundação de uma colônia, às vezes são construídos in situ — mas, com mais frequência, em planetas remotos, são lançados diretamente de naves colonizadoras.

entry.name: AstraMilitarum/Infantry
entry.value: Imperial Barracks

entry.name: AstraMilitarum/InfantryDescription
entry.value: Edifício que produz infantaria, aumenta o limite populacional e gera comida.

entry.name: AstraMilitarum/InfantryFlavor
entry.value: Embora o treinamento de recrutas da Guarda Imperial não tenha os horrores dilacerantes sofridos por iniciados Astartes, o Munitorum ainda precisa incutir as normas do Império nos homens e mulheres tributados que compõem a maioria dos regimentos da Guarda. Aqui, no Quartel, os recrutas pouco promissores de um planeta são transformados no verdadeiro Astra Militarum — dando‑lhes uniformes, armas e talvez até algum treinamento.

entry.name: AstraMilitarum/Influence
entry.value: Cogitator Station

entry.name: AstraMilitarum/InfluenceDescription
entry.value: Edifício que gera influência.

entry.name: AstraMilitarum/InfluenceFlavor
entry.value: Embora a inteligência artificial seja uma abominação, há muito abominada desde a queda dos Homens de Ferro, os arcaicos teares de dados do Adeptus Administratum pouco se assemelham aos computadores antigos ou mesmo aos delgados microprocessadores usados pelos Techpriests de Marte. As funções dos cogitators são puramente burocráticas, sua forma imóvel. Ainda assim, suas capacidades são valorizadas por todo mundo Imperial, unicamente por sua memória desumana.

entry.name: AstraMilitarum/Ore
entry.value: Ore Extractor

entry.name: AstraMilitarum/OreDescription
entry.value: Edifício que coleta minério.

entry.name: AstraMilitarum/OreFlavor
entry.value: Dependendo do planeta, a extração de minérios metálicos e minerais valiosos é realizada por qualquer coisa que vá desde máquinas de tecnologia antiga mal controladas por seus magos Techpriest até milhares de trabalhadores do Labour Corps, cumprindo seu papel na guerra para salvar a humanidade.

entry.name: AstraMilitarum/Psykers
entry.value: Psyker Coven

entry.name: AstraMilitarum/PsykersDescription
entry.value: Edifício que produz psíquicos e gera energia e influência.

entry.name: AstraMilitarum/PsykersFlavor
entry.value: Enquanto a tempestade da Dobra ruge, o uso em tempos de paz de psíquicos — como astropatas, para comunicação de longo alcance — é inútil. Da mesma forma, sem poder alcançar as Naves Negras, psíquicos indesejados não podem ser transportados a Terra para sacrifício no Trono Dourado. Em vez disso, a maioria é executada, com alguns poucos selecionados convocados ao serviço Imperial como Psíquicos Sancionados.

entry.name: AstraMilitarum/Research
entry.value: Officio Tactica

entry.name: AstraMilitarum/ResearchDescription
entry.value: Edifício que gera pesquisa.

entry.name: AstraMilitarum/ResearchFlavor
entry.value: Aprender a ser um oficial do Astra Militarum é uma tarefa ingrata e muitas vezes letal. Uma das designações mais seguras é no Officio Tactica, onde as mentes táticas mais brilhantes analisam manobras militares em andamento e recorrem aos copiosos textos do Tactica Imperialis em busca de conselhos comprovados. Eles também registram suas campanhas atuais, para que gerações futuras possam aprender com elas.

entry.name: AstraMilitarum/Upgrades
entry.value: Cult Mechanicus

entry.name: AstraMilitarum/UpgradesDescription
entry.value: Edifício que produz Techpriest Enginseers e gera pesquisa.

entry.name: AstraMilitarum/UpgradesFlavor
entry.value: A adoração dos Techpriests ao ‘Omnissiah’, um deus‑máquina, certamente seria reprovada, não fosse sua utilidade. Em vez disso, há um acordo tácito: os Techpriests reconhecem publicamente que o Imperador foi o Omnissiah e o Administratum concorda em não investigar de perto demais.

entry.name: AstraMilitarum/VehiclesDescription
entry.value: Edifício que produz veículos terrestres e gera minério e pesquisa.

entry.name: AstraMilitarum/VehiclesFlavor
entry.value: Chamar um Manufactorum Imperial de ‘fábrica’ é como chamar um Diabo de Catachan de inseto. Essas estruturas ciclópicas são enormes e imponentes templos ao Deus‑Máquina, onde seus milagres — aqui, veículos de guerra — são criados. Em seu interior, humildes serviçais estão condenados a nunca ver a superfície do planeta, enquanto ministram incessantemente aos abençoados motores de Marte.

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/Aircraft
entry.value: Helhaunted Eyrie

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/AircraftDescription
entry.value: Edifício que produz Heldrakes, além de gerar lealdade e influência.

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/AircraftFlavor
entry.value: Há 10.000 anos, os Heldrakes eram caças, pilotados pela elite do Adeptus Astartes. Agora, são hediondas amalgamas de homem e máquina, moldadas por milênios de guerra em criaturas dracônicas que vivem para lutar. Este ninho artificial permite aos Warpsmiths e ao Master of Possession monitorar os Heldrakes e até tentar replicar sua criação ancestral.

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/Construction
entry.value: Warp Forge

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/ConstructionDescription
entry.value: Edifício que constrói novos edifícios e gera minério e influência.

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/ConstructionFlavor
entry.value: Embora as Soul Forges dos Warpsmiths estejam no âmago do Reino do Caos e, portanto, inacessíveis a partir de Gladius, o Caos é, acima de tudo, maleável. Estas Warp Forges são mantidas ardentes pelo sacrifício diário de milhares de civis, capturados nas ruínas de seu Mundo Colmeia caído, para puxar as construções atadas à Dobra do Caos à cintilante existência.

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/Cult
entry.value: Cult of Chaos

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/CultDescription
entry.value: Edifício que produz unidades especiais do Caos e aumenta a lealdade.

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/CultFlavor
entry.value: O que são deuses sem seguidores? Aqui, Cultists e Dark Apostles tramam igualmente para trazer conversos ao culto do Caos — não é tarefa difícil em Gladius, quando se veem os xenos desumanos, os efeitos indubitáveis dos poderes dos Deuses Sombrios e as formas Demoníacas espreitando no santuário.

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/Energy
entry.value: Warpbound Generator

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/EnergyDescription
entry.value: Edifício que gera energia.

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/EnergyFlavor
entry.value: Os Techpriests caídos do Caos — agora Warpsmiths do Dark Mechanicum — tiveram dez mil anos para calibrar seus dispositivos além das restrições do Omnissiah. Tão poderoso quanto um Gerador de Plasma convencional, este artefato pode ser erguido rapidamente in situ. Seu espírito demoníaco extrai energia do cintilar de um rasgo no Empíreo para carregar um dispositivo de movimento infernal.

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/FoodDescription
entry.value: Edifício que coleta comida.

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/FoodFlavor
entry.value: Suas tropas estão, em sua maioria, além dos desejos mortais — mas os homens‑fera, mutantes e escravos que mantêm suas cidades não estão. Para alimentá‑los, corpos de todo tipo são trazidos às estações de processamento, para deleite dos degenerados de Slaanesh que as operam e de alimento para as massas de trabalhadores — os mais fortes, ao menos. Os mais fracos são o jantar.

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/Loyalty
entry.value: Meadow of Sorrow

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/LoyaltyDescription
entry.value: Edifício que aumenta a lealdade.

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/LoyaltyFlavor
entry.value: Não deve ter sido um seguidor de Khorne quem chamou esta planície de ‘prado’ — alegoria não é um traço das tropas do Deus do Sangue. Seja quem for, a metáfora é adequada: fileiras cuidadosamente plantadas, cuidadas conscienciosamente, as lacunas preenchidas conforme se esvaziam. Mas são os devotos de Slaanesh que ‘cultivam’ esses campos, concebendo constantemente prazeres ímpios em honra ao seu Deus, à custa de suas vítimas.

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/Headquarters
entry.value: Dark Fortress

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/HeadquartersDescription
entry.value: Edifício de quartel‑general que gera recursos.

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/HeadquartersFlavor
entry.value: Nem dez mil anos de heresia eliminaram por completo o treinamento de um Traidor. Tal como seus irmãos Adeptus Astartes, os Traitor Marines preferem operar a partir de uma posição defensiva segura e bem construída — de preferência erguida pelos Iron Warriors. Serve como base de operações avançada para seus saques e pilhagens.

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/Heroes
entry.value: Lord's Quarters

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/HeroesDescription
entry.value: Edifício que produz heróis, gera influência e aumenta a lealdade.

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/HeroesFlavor
entry.value: Chamar qualquer Chaos Space Marine — assassinos, sádicos, psicopatas e monstros, todos eles — de ‘herói’ é uma contradição em termos. Mas há exemplares notáveis: os Feiticeiros, Mestres e Campeões do Caos que lideram bandos de guerra e seguem os ditames e comandos dos Deuses. Aqui eles se reúnem, sob os olhos vigilantes de seu Lorde.

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/Housing
entry.value: Captive Pens

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/HousingDescription
entry.value: Edifício que aumenta o limite populacional.

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/HousingFlavor
entry.value: De todos os deuses, apenas o Pai Nurgle parece ‘cuidar’ de seus adoradores. E seus devotos ‘cuidam’ dos escravos que operam a cidade, confinando‑os em alojamentos perfeitos para cultivar doenças e pestilências, ao mesmo tempo mantendo alguns fisicamente e mentalmente robustos o bastante para cumprir os muitos papéis horrendos que seus mestres Astartes caídos lhes exigem.

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/Infantry
entry.value: Abominator's Genelab

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/InfantryDescription
entry.value: Edifício que produz infantaria e gera comida e pesquisa.

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/InfantryFlavor
entry.value: Nem todos os Chaos Space Marines datam do 30º milênio — outros são recrutados entre civis, brutalmente alterados com geneseed tomado de um Marine caído. Neste genelab, Apothecaries renegados operam os cultistas mais fortes vindos das Colmeias arruinadas de Gladius. Os poucos que sobrevivem às operações dos Abominators recebem implantes de glândulas Progenoid e são recrutados como novos Chaos Space Marines.

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/Influence
entry.value: Altar to Chaos

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/InfluenceDescription
entry.value: Edifício que gera influência.

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/InfluenceFlavor
entry.value: ‘Caos Indiviso’ é uma contradição em termos. Observando os Demônios de cada Deus — os Horrors que gargalham, os Plaguebearers que zumbem, os Bloodletters em fúria, as Daemonettes arfantes — nada poderia ser mais dissimilar. Ainda assim, este altar revela a brutal comunalidade por trás do Caos: Uma pedra escura. Solo encharcado de sangue. A faca erguida. E a bacanal.

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/Ore
entry.value: Slave Mines

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/OreDescription
entry.value: Edifício que coleta minério.

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/OreFlavor
entry.value: Até os Orks têm maneiras melhores de tirar metal do solo do que esta — mas a preocupação dos Lordes do Caos com seus servos não é evitar o sofrimento, e sim garanti‑lo. Estas minas são grosseiramente cruéis, projetadas para suscitar esperança antes de esmagá‑la. Elas cultivam almas torturadas para o Caos tanto quanto extraem minério.

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/Research
entry.value: Archive of the Ways

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/ResearchDescription
entry.value: Edifício que gera pesquisa.

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/ResearchFlavor
entry.value: Em mundos Demoníacos, contadores de histórias falam de uma biblioteca perdida na Dobra que contém todos os pensamentos de Tzeentch. Em sua riqueza, dizem, rivaliza a Black Library dos Aeldari ou o infinito sem sentido da Biblioteca de Babel. Exista ou não o memorial de Tzeentch, um Archive of the Ways é o reflexo no mundo real desse mito do falso‑mundo — um lugar onde verdades podem ser criadas, não descobertas.

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/Vehicles
entry.value: Infernal Fabricator

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/VehiclesDescription
entry.value: Edifício que produz veículos terrestres e gera minério e influência.

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/VehiclesFlavor
entry.value: Normalmente confinadas às Soul Forges da Dobra, essas incompreensíveis estruturas mecanoides são responsáveis pela criação de todos os veículos Demoníacos. Aqui, Warpsmiths envoltos por mechatendrils supervisionam a quebra e a corrupção dos Espíritos da Máquina de veículos Imperiais capturados, bem como a incorporação forçada de Lesser Daemons, maquinário e carne torturada em Daemon Engines.

entry.name: CompendiumFlavor
entry.value: Das cabanas das favelas dos Orks, às colmeias de bilhões de pessoas do Imperium, aos Mundos-Nave espaciais dos Aeldari, às antigas mastabas dos Necrons, quase todas as raças produzem estruturas para satisfazer suas necessidades — seja para construção, abrigo ou mero orgulho. Talvez apenas os Tyranids, em sua busca insaciável por novos materiais biológicos, não possuam estruturas permanentes, dependendo de uma gama de organismos de procriação semimóveis…

entry.name: Drukhari/AircraftDescription
entry.value: Edifício que produz aeronaves e gera energia, pesquisa e minério.

entry.name: Drukhari/AircraftFlavor
entry.value: As antigas torres de Commorragh abrigam horrores por dentro e por fora. No topo, ficam as moradas de Scourges e Hellions, Drukhari que cavalgam as correntes de ar que sobem das profundezas impossíveis da cidade impossível — de suas máquinas, tormentos e morte. Mesmo aqui, no condenado mundo de Gladius Prime, esses monstros etéreos têm seu lugar.

entry.name: Drukhari/Construction
entry.value: Taskmaster Estate

entry.name: Drukhari/ConstructionDescription
entry.value: Edifício que constrói novos edifícios, coleta minério, gera pesquisa e aumenta o crescimento.

entry.name: Drukhari/ConstructionFlavor
entry.value: “Tão grande era o medo, tão horríveis os castigos, que a ameaça da dor era uma motivação muito maior do que a própria dor, de modo que raramente precisávamos usá‑la. Mas usá‑la nós usamos, uma tortura imprevisível movida por nossa insidiosa depravação, e nossos operários respondiam com presteza…” — Ilthea, a Desbotada, ex‑Archon do Kabal Coração Murchado, prisioneira do Inquisidor Jey Carnaa.

entry.name: Drukhari/EnergyDescription
entry.value: Edifício que gera energia.

entry.name: Drukhari/EnergyFlavor
entry.value: Como os antigos Aeldari capturaram os corações de estrelas moribundas e os transportaram para seus portos comerciais no webway é algo impossível de explicar fora de equações abstrusas. Ainda assim, essas estrelas negras agora fornecem energia a toda Commorragh. Em incursões no espaço real, para energia, os Drukhari empregam um dispositivo gerador que reflete a glória dessas estrelas torturadas.

entry.name: Drukhari/Food
entry.value: Sustenance Den

entry.name: Drukhari/FoodDescription
entry.value: Edifício que coleta comida.

entry.name: Drukhari/FoodFlavor
entry.value: Os próprios Drukhari comem pouco, subsistindo principalmente do sofrimento de suas vítimas e trabalhadores cativos. O que consomem são luxos incomuns, repletos de angústia, produzidos a custos improváveis. Mas as massas de seus operários requerem alimento para cumprir as tarefas terríveis que lhes são exigidas, e eles o produzem aqui, com eficiência, sem desperdiçar nada.

entry.name: Drukhari/Headquarters
entry.value: Raider Fortress

entry.name: Drukhari/HeadquartersDescription
entry.value: Edifício de quartel‑general que gera recursos.

entry.name: Drukhari/HeadquartersFlavor
entry.value: “Oh, sombria Commorragh, como sinto tua falta. Tuas ruas de dor e ícor, os deleites de teus jardins sombrios, o bramido da multidão na arena, as torres dos Archons infestadas de hellions… em minha cela, recordações são tudo o que tenho.” — Ilthea, a Desbotada, ex‑Archon do Kabal Coração Murchado, prisioneira do Inquisidor Jey Carnaa.

entry.name: Drukhari/HeroesDescription
entry.value: Edifício que produz heróis, gera influência e aumenta a lealdade.

entry.name: Drukhari/HeroesFlavor
entry.value: As torres de Commorragh começam nos antigos distritos comerciais do Império Aeldari, mas se erguem pela Dimensão Labiríntica, ligadas por suas físicas não euclidianas por pontes delgadas. Aqui vivem os Archons, Dracons e líderes dos Kabals, em relativa segurança e luxo.

entry.name: Drukhari/Housing
entry.value: Cage Den

entry.name: Drukhari/HousingDescription
entry.value: Edifício que aumenta o limite populacional.

entry.name: Drukhari/HousingFlavor
entry.value: Os Kabalites e Wyches não vivem aqui, é claro — em geral retornam a Commorragh entre as incursões. Mas os antigos cidadãos das grandes cidades‑colmeia de Gladius Prime são agora, ah, trabalhadores vinculados dos Drukhari. As acomodações — gaiolas de malha cortante abertas aos elementos, patrulhadas por guardas sádicos — são apenas marginalmente piores do que os humanos já estavam acostumados.

entry.name: Drukhari/Infantry
entry.value: Kabalite Stronghold

entry.name: Drukhari/InfantryDescription
entry.value: Edifício que produz infantaria, gera influência e comida e aumenta o limite populacional.

entry.name: Drukhari/InfantryFlavor
entry.value: Os Kabals dos Drukhari são uma mistura de cartel criminoso, fraternidade pirata e casa nobre, como a antiga Máfia ou as Tríades da Terra. Um Kabal seleciona apenas o melhor (ou o pior) da sociedade Drukhari — sádicos, ladrões, assassinos — em outras palavras, os pilares da comunidade Drukhari. Eles também fornecem a força militar de Commorragh, empregada em sua defesa ou em incursões no espaço real.

entry.name: Drukhari/Influence
entry.value: Bone Middens

entry.name: Drukhari/InfluenceDescription
entry.value: Edifício que gera influência.

entry.name: Drukhari/InfluenceFlavor
entry.value: Este enorme ossuário é composto por milhões de esqueletos, representativos de cada espécie autoconsciente existente, variando em tamanho de insetos a colossos maciços, posicionados em lúgubres tableaus e falsas batalhas. É um reflexo da tortura e morte mais amplas que ocorrem por todo o domínio Drukhari.

entry.name: Drukhari/Loyalty
entry.value: Cult Arena

entry.name: Drukhari/LoyaltyDescription
entry.value: Edifício que aumenta a lealdade.

entry.name: Drukhari/LoyaltyFlavor
entry.value: As Wyches e Succubi atemporais das Arenas Drukhari tratam seu combate assassino como o ápice da elegância, surgindo graciosamente trajadas nas mais recentes ‘modas de esfolar’ para decapitar e torturar grupos de combatentes de cada vez, em estilos que definirão o assassinato por muitas, muitas horas. O público compartilha do sofrimento e do entretenimento, saindo revigorado e estimulado pela matança em massa.

entry.name: Drukhari/OreDescription
entry.value: Edifício que coleta minério.

entry.name: Drukhari/OreFlavor
entry.value: Nos portos de escambo cosmopolitas do império Drukhari, todas as raças podem ser encontradas — como mercenários, como comerciantes e até como mercadorias. Tudo o que se pode sonhar pode ser encontrado lá, roubado ou barganhado. Este pálido reflexo de sua glória troca as riquezas de Gladius Prime por metais.

entry.name: Drukhari/Research
entry.value: Haemonculi Laboratory

entry.name: Drukhari/ResearchDescription
entry.value: Edifício que gera pesquisa.

entry.name: Drukhari/ResearchFlavor
entry.value: Os cruéis e antigos Drukhari conhecidos como Haemonculi vivem nas entranhas sombrias da Cidade Negra. Aqui realizam experimentos físicos sobre os fracos, desesperados ou vinculados, transformando‑os em Wracks, Grotesques, Cronos e mais. O conhecimento perdido nos crânios retorcidos desses imortais pode ser recuperado, mas o sacrifício é tentar a comunicação…

entry.name: Drukhari/Vehicles
entry.value: Dark Foundry

entry.name: Drukhari/VehiclesDescription
entry.value: Edifício que produz veículos terrestres e criaturas monstruosas, coleta minério e gera pesquisa.

entry.name: Drukhari/VehiclesFlavor
entry.value: As fundições materiais de Commorragh existem nas profundezas sob a cidade, onde incontáveis trabalhadores Drukhari e xenos vivem e morrem sem jamais ver a luz de seus sóis negros, mantidos em dor, tormento e miséria constantes, movidos pelo medo da morte. Os requisitadores dos Kabals fazem o possível para replicar esse ideal onde quer que viajem.

entry.name: Eldar/Aircraft
entry.value: Portal Spire

entry.name: Eldar/AircraftDescription
entry.value: Edifício que produz aeronaves, além de gerar energia, pesquisa e influência.

entry.name: Eldar/AircraftFlavor
entry.value: Erguida bem acima do solo, esta abertura espiral da Teia permite que as aeronaves Aeldari viajem diretamente do imaterium para Gladius Prime, enquanto têm uma transição mais lenta de pressão do ar, composição e gravidade local em comparação com as formas sobrenaturais presentes no espaço distorcido entre as estrelas.

entry.name: Eldar/Construction
entry.value: Capela dos Cantores de Osso

entry.name: Eldar/ConstructionDescription
entry.value: Edifício que constrói novos edifícios, além de coletar minério, gerar pesquisa e aumentar o crescimento.

entry.name: Eldar/ConstructionFlavor
entry.value: Muitos dos caminhos que os Aeldari percorrem em suas longas vidas não são violentos — na verdade, a maioria não é, pois os Aeldari dos Mundos-Nave foram aqueles que rejeitaram as vidas hedonistas de seus pares por uma de contemplação. Os Cantores de Osso são artesãos que manipulam psiquicamente o Osso Espectral para criar as estruturas e maquinarias que os Aeldari usam.

entry.name: Eldar/Energy
entry.value: Gerador de Termoplasma

entry.name: Eldar/EnergyDescription
entry.value: Edifício que gera energia.

entry.name: Eldar/EnergyFlavor
entry.value: Muito mais elegante que seus equivalentes Imperiais, este gerador de plasma portátil foi trazido através da Teia com grande risco. Ele usa tecnologia semelhante à versão Imperial, mas tem uma produção muito maior para um dispositivo muito menor.

entry.name: Eldar/Food
entry.value: Jardins de Isha

entry.name: Eldar/FoodDescription
entry.value: Edifício que coleta comida.

entry.name: Eldar/FoodFlavor
entry.value: No mito Aeldari, Isha foi a mãe dos Aeldari, que os trouxe à existência и os protegeu de Khaine. Acredita-se também que ela seja uma das três divindades Aeldari sobreviventes, aprisionada no domínio do Deus do Caos Nurgle. Nestes jardins em Gladius, os Aeldari que seguem o Caminho do Artesão seguem seus ensinamentos e cultivam alimentos frescos e saudáveis para as forças Aeldari locais. Sua contribuição para a vida Aeldari é considerada tão valiosa quanto a de qualquer guerreiro ou vidente.

entry.name: Eldar/Headquarters
entry.value: Webway Redoubt

entry.name: Eldar/HeadquartersDescription
entry.value: Edifício de quartel-general que gera recursos.

entry.name: Eldar/HeadquartersFlavor
entry.value: A Teia perfura Gladius Prime, mas muitos dos portões foram perdidos. Mesmo aqueles que sobrevivem são inimaginavelmente antigos, mas ainda permanecem, ignorados pelas raças mais jovens. Ao redor deles, os Aeldari constroem posições e maquinários, para estabilizar a conexão renovada dos portões com o imaterium e defendê-los contra incursões.

entry.name: Eldar/Heroes
entry.value: Shrine of Khaine

entry.name: Eldar/HeroesDescription
entry.value: Edifício que produz heróis, além de gerar pesquisa e influência.

entry.name: Eldar/HeroesFlavor
entry.value: Embora Asuryan fosse a divindade suprema dos Aeldari, seu irmão Khaine era seu igual em poder. Todos os guerreiros se devotam a Khaine, com aqueles que se perdem no Caminho da Guerra tornando-se seus Exarcas e Autarcas. Em contraste, aqueles perdidos no Caminho do Vidente tornam-se Videntes, incapazes de retornar aos outros caminhos que podem ter percorrido — e os Aeldari não consideram o sacrifício da liberdade pelo poder como válido.

entry.name: Eldar/Housing
entry.value: Ghost Halls

entry.name: Eldar/HousingDescription
entry.value: Edifício que aumenta o limite populacional.

entry.name: Eldar/HousingFlavor
entry.value: As Asuryan was dying, consumed by Slaanesh, he blessed the Aeldari; he gave them long life and great psychic power; but he also doomed their fertility. Over time, Aeldari numbers have dwindled until now, when the great halls that once housed millions only house thousands. Here, on Gladius Prime, the ghost halls provide a taste of luxurious Aeldari living for those not fighting in the field.

entry.name: Eldar/Infantry
entry.value: Asuryan's Crucible

entry.name: Eldar/InfantryDescription
entry.value: Building that produces infantry as well as generates research and increases loyalty.

entry.name: Eldar/InfantryFlavor
entry.value: Asuryan, the Phoenix King, was the chief of the Aeldari Gods and the last to be consumed by Slaanesh during the fall of the Aeldari. He has long been an inspiration to the Craftworld Aeldari, who often refer to themselves as ‘Asuryani’. At this muster ground, new arrivals to Gladius are equipped and assigned to squads before being tested in the field.

entry.name: Eldar/Influence
entry.value: Dome of the Seers

entry.name: Eldar/InfluenceDescription
entry.value: Building that generates influence.

entry.name: Eldar/InfluenceFlavor
entry.value: When one sees the tracery of wraithbone growing into the sky; when one hears an unearthly song from a labourer who has lived longer than the Imperium has existed; when one sees an elegant figure talking with authority about the future to come; perhaps you might concede that the Aeldari have good reason to behave with arrogance…

entry.name: Eldar/Loyalty
entry.value: Cairn of Ulthanesh

entry.name: Eldar/LoyaltyDescription
entry.value: Building that increases loyalty.

entry.name: Eldar/LoyaltyFlavor
entry.value: Eldanesh was the first Aeldari. He and his kinsman Ulthanesh were the two greatest heroes of Aeldari mythology, battling the new people’s enemies alongside Khaine, the God of War. Eventually, the two heroes fell out and Ulthanesh went his own way. But when Khaine killed Eldanesh in rage, Ulthanesh fought alongside his kinsman’s house against the god and became proverbial for his loyalty.

entry.name: Eldar/Ore
entry.value: Altmarl of Vaul

entry.name: Eldar/OreDescription
entry.value: Building that harvests ore.

entry.name: Eldar/OreFlavor
entry.value: The smith god Vaul was known for his fantastic creations. Though the surviving myths focus mostly on his weapons (notably his hundred swords), he created many devices the Aeldari still use today—like this automated mine, which requires the barest supervision to extract the ore needed for his other creations.

entry.name: Eldar/Research
entry.value: Spirit Ossuary

entry.name: Eldar/ResearchDescription
entry.value: Building that generates research.

entry.name: Eldar/ResearchFlavor
entry.value: Here, spiritseers interrogate the spiritstones of the dead. The Aeldari do not invent and they rarely research these days—their technology is mostly stagnant, having been inherited from the Old Ones, but unlike the Imperial priesthood of Mars they do at least understand its function. Here they can consult the wisest minds of their history for solutions to any problem—though their response isn’t always clear or quick.

entry.name: Eldar/Vehicles
entry.value: Greater Ingress

entry.name: Eldar/VehiclesDescription
entry.value: Building that produces ground vehicles as well as harvests ore and generates research.

entry.name: Eldar/VehiclesFlavor
entry.value: This extension to the Webway Portal allows larger vehicles to access Gladius Prime. Without it, the Aeldari forces would just be infantry and jetbikes—enough for a Harlequin Troupe or a Biel-Tan vanguard perhaps, but not for a true war effort.

entry.name: Necrons/Aircraft
entry.value: Nameless Causeway

entry.name: Necrons/AircraftDescription
entry.value: Building that produces aircraft as well as generates energy, influence and increases loyalty.

entry.name: Necrons/AircraftFlavor
entry.value: If the Necron are dreaded across the known universe, their aircraft are doubly feared. The Doom Scythe and Night Scythe are fast, hardy and deadly to armoured opponents. Launching from a bleak expanse of stone, they devastate enemies with their irresistible assaults.

entry.name: Necrons/Construction
entry.value: Slave Mastaba

entry.name: Necrons/ConstructionDescription
entry.value: Building that constructs new buildings as well as generates energy, influence and increases loyalty.

entry.name: Necrons/ConstructionFlavor
entry.value: Everyone has a place in Necron society. The weak-fleshed races of the Old Ones live out their days under crude shelters, where they scrape together their own food, before being sent out to excavate the Necron's long-buried tombs and retrieve the sleeping Necrons.

entry.name: Necrons/Energy
entry.value: Energy Core

entry.name: Necrons/EnergyDescription
entry.value: Building that generates energy.

entry.name: Necrons/EnergyFlavor
entry.value: Whatever the baroque technology is that the Necron use in their great Energy Cores, it outshines even the Imperial Plasma Ioniser for sheer power—and it needs to, given that the Necron dynasty depends upon its power supplies as other races do on water or food.

entry.name: Necrons/Loyalty
entry.value: Baroque Shrine

entry.name: Necrons/LoyaltyDescription
entry.value: Building that increases loyalty.

entry.name: Necrons/LoyaltyFlavor
entry.value: While the Stelae talk of the ancient Necrontyr's victories and glories, this Shrine tells a darker story. It details their conversion to metal and subjugation by the C'tan, and of Szarekh the Silent King and his long-planned betrayal and destruction of the soul-eating Star Gods. Even amongst the soulless Necrons, this inspires reverence.

entry.name: Necrons/Headquarters
entry.value: Royal Court

entry.name: Necrons/HeadquartersDescription
entry.value: Headquarters building that generates resources.

entry.name: Necrons/HeadquartersFlavor
entry.value: The seat of the Necron Phaeron and his court is a great bleak building, one of the few great Necron buildings not originally built to venerate the dead. Instead, its shielding walls are a symbolic reflection of the intense radiation the Necrons suffered under, long ago, on their original homeworld, when they were still weak creatures of flesh and bone.

entry.name: Necrons/Heroes
entry.value: Royal Pyramid

entry.name: Necrons/HeroesDescription
entry.value: Building that produces heroes as well as generates influence and increases loyalty.

entry.name: Necrons/HeroesFlavor
entry.value: The tomb of the Phaeron, Overlord or Lord and his court, this is where all the most loyal and important retainers retreated to sleep away the centuries until the universe was ready again. Even now, great heroes still lie sleeping in its core, awaiting their Lords' call.

entry.name: Necrons/HousingDescription
entry.value: Building that increases population limit.

entry.name: Necrons/HousingFlavor
entry.value: Given the average Necron's lack of need for water, food or entertainment, these shelters don't resemble a human shelter or even an Ork shack. Instead, they're partway between a barracks, a tomb and a workshop, where the Crypteks and Canoptek constructs move between dormant Necron warriors, endless maintaining and repairing them.

entry.name: Necrons/Infantry
entry.value: Summoning Core

entry.name: Necrons/InfantryDescription
entry.value: Building that produces infantry and creatures as well as generates research and increases loyalty.

entry.name: Necrons/InfantryFlavor
entry.value: Awakening the long-deactivated troops of a Necron dynasty is slow work, as is repairing those who fall in the field. The Canopteks and Crypteks of the Summoning Core diligently save those who recall to the city—and dismantle the rest for their rare Necrodermis.

entry.name: Necrons/InfluenceDescription
entry.value: Building that generates influence.

entry.name: Necrons/InfluenceFlavor
entry.value: Imposing, sky-piercing columns of ancient stone and metal, each Stela records the reign of a long-ago Phaeron of the Necron dynasty. To see the records of millennia of implacable domination makes even the most stolid citizen of the Empire quail.

entry.name: Necrons/Ore
entry.value: Al-Khemic Quarry

entry.name: Necrons/OreDescription
entry.value: Building that harvests ore.

entry.name: Necrons/OreFlavor
entry.value: To find the rare materials the Crypteks need to maintain and repair the living metal necrodermis and weaponry of the Necron troops, slaves live and die in their Al-Khemic quarries and smelters. Only a tiny fraction of the output is used—but it's critical to the Necrons' survival.

entry.name: Necrons/Research
entry.value: Forbidden Archive

entry.name: Necrons/ResearchDescription
entry.value: Building that generates research.

entry.name: Necrons/ResearchFlavor
entry.value: Before the fall, Necron Crypteks were already masters of eldritch technology, able to manipulate matter and energy in ways that seemed magical to lesser races. With immortality came generations of learning, and the Cryptek conclaves become more powerful than ever—yet the millenia have made them stagnant. In these archives, the Conclave digs for the wisdom of the ancients, rather discovering the secrets of the universe anew.

entry.name: Necrons/Vehicles
entry.value: Hypostyle Temple

entry.name: Necrons/VehiclesDescription
entry.value: Building that produces ground vehicles as well as generates energy and increases loyalty.

entry.name: Necrons/VehiclesFlavor
entry.value: This high-roofed building is lined with pillars inside. Between them rest or float the great war machines of the Necrons. Deactivated Doomsday Arks, Annihilation Barges, Monoliths and Obelisks wait in serried ranks for the day when a Lord calls for their repair and they can lead his armies once more.

entry.name: Orks/Beasts
entry.value: Runtherd Groundz

entry.name: Orks/BeastsDescription
entry.value: Building that produces beasts, generates food and increases loyalty.

entry.name: Orks/BeastsFlavor
entry.value: Runtherds do much of the heavy lifting in Ork society, overseeing the Grots who build everything, the Squigs who supply almost all resources and the tiny Snots who are both carers and food for the Squigs. However, on these grounds they also oversee larger projects—like training Grotz gun crews and rearing the giant Squiggoths.

entry.name: Orks/Colonizers
entry.value: Mek Bitz Yard

entry.name: Orks/ColonizersDescription
entry.value: Building that produces Meks and Mek Gunz as well as generates research.

entry.name: Orks/ColonizersFlavor
entry.value: A Mek never knows when inspiration is going to hit and he suddenly needs a Thingummy or a Whatyamacallit for his latest invention. For this reason, a Mek's yard is full of broken-up vehicles, machines and tools in case he needs anything suddenly to hand, with teams of lugubrious Grotz endlessly hauling more stuff in.

entry.name: Orks/Construction
entry.value: Scrap Shedz

entry.name: Orks/ConstructionDescription
entry.value: Building that constructs new buildings, generates ore and influence as well as increases population limit.

entry.name: Orks/ConstructionFlavor
entry.value: Ork buildings are inelegant constructions of waste materials and any scrap that the Meks don't need. The Grotz aren't known to be good architects, but the Orks don't care so long as they get a good fight.

entry.name: Orks/Energy
entry.value: Powwa Gubbinz

entry.name: Orks/EnergyDescription
entry.value: Building that generates energy.

entry.name: Orks/EnergyFlavor
entry.value: It doesn't pay an Ork to look too closely at the generators that power their world. That's because much of the technology that Ork Meks produce is missing key parts and shouldn't actually work—but the massed psychic belief of Orks somehow overrides this.

entry.name: Orks/Food
entry.value: Squig Herdz

entry.name: Orks/FoodDescription
entry.value: Building that harvests food.

entry.name: Orks/FoodFlavor
entry.value: Squigz are essential to the survival of the Ork species. A huge variety of these small creatures accompany every Ork, and fill an array of social and technological niches—from acting as wigs, to providing oil, to being eaten as food.

entry.name: Orks/Loyalty
entry.value: Fighting Pitz

entry.name: Orks/LoyaltyDescription
entry.value: Building that increases loyalty.

entry.name: Orks/LoyaltyFlavor
entry.value: Orks don't establish dominance by persuasion, but by brute force. A Nob or Warboss is simply a bigger Ork—and the longer they fight, the bigger they get. Fights for dominance or disputes are often worked out in the ritual pits, entertaining the whole Warband in the process. (It's an unfortunate Ork that confuses these pits with the identical looking 'drops'—the Ork toilets.)

entry.name: Orks/Headquarters
entry.value: Boss Tower

entry.name: Orks/HeadquartersDescription
entry.value: Headquarters building that generates resources.

entry.name: Orks/HeadquartersFlavor
entry.value: Once a Warboss has amassed an army of a certain size, he can no longer command with the simple cudgelling and swearing his boyz have grown to love. The Boss Tower doubles up as a place for the boss to live and a bully pulpit from which he can bellow at his hordes.

entry.name: Orks/Heroes
entry.value: Kommando Kamp

entry.name: Orks/HeroesDescription
entry.value: Building that produces heroes as well as generates influence and increases loyalty.

entry.name: Orks/HeroesFlavor
entry.value: The Blood Axe Clan of Orks are somewhat shunned by their brethren, for not being 'real Orks'. This is because they've adapted to the proximity of humans over the long-millenia and adopted some very un-Orky behaviour, like Taktiks and Runnin Away. Blood Axe Kommandos have gone one step further, using camouflage to surprise their enemies.

entry.name: Orks/Housing
entry.value: Grotz Hutz

entry.name: Orks/HousingDescription
entry.value: Building that increases population limit.

entry.name: Orks/HousingFlavor
entry.value: Curiously, the Grotz' Hutz are better than those of the Boyz. Sure, from the outside they look even more ramshackle and run-down, while the inside is still built from garbage festooned with mushrooms, squigs and snotlings. But there's a certain pride and personalisation in the squalor that the Boyz' shacks lack.

entry.name: Orks/Infantry
entry.value: Pile O' Dakka

entry.name: Orks/InfantryDescription
entry.value: Building that produces infantry and walkers as well as generates food and influence, and increases loyalty.

entry.name: Orks/InfantryFlavor
entry.value: 'What's better than a gun?' asks an Ork. 'A bigga gun', answers another. Shortly before the fight starts, they agree that, even better than the biggest gun, is a big pile of big guns. That's exactly what we have here—Mek-made guns of all shapes and sizes, loosely stacked, ready for a Boy or Killa Kan to grab when the fighting starts.

entry.name: Orks/Influence
entry.value: Weirdboyz Pole

entry.name: Orks/InfluenceDescription
entry.value: Building that generates influence.

entry.name: Orks/InfluenceFlavor
entry.value: The Ork psykers known as Weirdboyz are a peril at the quietest of times, given their endless accumulation of Waaagh! energy—and in the middle of a horde, a brain bursting chain reaction is normal. This giant metal pole is the Orks' ingenious answer, earthing the psykers' psychic blasts as long as they're tied to it.

entry.name: Orks/Ore
entry.value: Diggaz and Smeltaz

entry.name: Orks/OreDescription
entry.value: Building that harvests ore.

entry.name: Orks/OreFlavor
entry.value: When Orks can't get scrap, they'll instead order their Grot serfs to dig up ore-rich rocks. Whilst the Snakebites are happy to use manual labour and whips, most clans' Meks come up with preposterous and crude inventions for extracting the ore, which have varying degrees of lethality for their unlucky Grot operators.

entry.name: Orks/Research
entry.value: Fink Tank

entry.name: Orks/ResearchDescription
entry.value: Building that generates research.

entry.name: Orks/ResearchFlavor
entry.value: One of the more persistent myths of the Orks is about their long-vanished creators, the 'Brainboyz', who they believe encoded highly advanced technology into the Orks' genes aeons ago. Meks, Doks and Runtherdz are Orks who display this knowledge—and the Fink Tank is a good place to lock 'em until they remember another good idea.

entry.name: Orks/Vehicles
entry.value: Kult ov Speed

entry.name: Orks/VehiclesDescription
entry.value: Building that produces wheeled vehicles and aircraft as well as generates ore and influence, and increases loyalty.

entry.name: Orks/VehiclesFlavor
entry.value: Though they still love war and big explosions, the Orks known as Speed Freeks love velocity even more. They will extensively and obsessively customise their bikes and aircraft, removing all the safety features, to the point where they're sitting on a giant engine—painted crimson because 'red wunz go fasta'.

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/Auxiliaries
entry.value: Ecclesiarchal Reinforcements

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/AuxiliariesDescription
entry.value: Building that produces aircraft and imperial knights as well as generates requisitions and energy.

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/AuxiliariesFlavor
entry.value: Unusually for an Adepta Sororitas mission, not all the troops here are Battle Sisters. Though the other local forces of the Imperium have proved to be untrustworthy, the remaining Imperial Navy and Knightly Houses have found themselves with divided loyalties. Those who have sided with the Adepta Sororitas have been assigned these unprepossessing buildings for accommodation, repair and habitation.

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/Construction
entry.value: Ministorum Workshop

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/ConstructionDescription
entry.value: Building that constructs new buildings and generates influence.

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/ConstructionFlavor
entry.value: More primitive it might be than the great manufactora of the Adeptus Mechanicus and Adeptus Administratum, but what the workers of a Ministorum workshop lack in technical knowledge, they make up for in religious fervour and craftsmanship. The buildings they create are not merely functional—they are works of worship and art for the God-Emperor himself.

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/EnclaveDescription
entry.value: Smaller headquarters building that generates resources.

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/EnclaveFlavor
entry.value: These smaller city-bastions act as missions and staging posts for Adepta Sororitas activities in their region. From here, preachers and missionaries venture out into the dangerous wastes of the destroyed hive world, winning converts and ensuring the safe passage of resources back to the mother city.

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/Energy
entry.value: Munitorum Generators

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/EnergyDescription
entry.value: Building that generates energy.

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/EnergyFlavor
entry.value: Though the Departmento Munitorum is tasked solely with supplying the Astra Militarum across the galaxy, certain of their standardised technologies are used by other Imperial forces. Using the ancient plasma ioniser technology beloved of Mars, these carefully cooled systems can maintain 100 petawatts of power with ease—though without Tech-Priests to maintain them, the Adepta Sororitas typically run them cooler.

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/HeadquartersDescription
entry.value: Headquarters building that generates resources.

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/HeadquartersFlavor
entry.value: The centre of the Adepta Sororitas’ efforts on Gladius Prime, this city-fortress can take a sister from cradle to grave, passing her through her novitiate to being a true Battle Sister. Such a city is the seat of this world’s faith, ringing with auto-choral prayers day and night, its air saturated with the smell of sacred unguents, blessed oils and burnt heretics. Yet beneath its lofty spires, the mass of humanity works, lives and dies unnoticed.

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/Heroes
entry.value: Legatines' Priory

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/HeroesDescription
entry.value: Building that produces heroes and Hospitallers as well as generates influence and increases loyalty.

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/HeroesFlavor
entry.value: The highest-ranking Sisters of an Order are a mix of warriors, healers and spiritual leaders—but not all of them have formal positions, despite the fervour and veneration they inspire in their peers. This priory serves a gathering point for these Legatines when away from their orders, with all the comforts of home—shrines, chapels, cells and places of ritual scourging.

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/Housing
entry.value: Cells Urbis

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/HousingDescription
entry.value: Building that increases population limit.

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/HousingFlavor
entry.value: Are the cells of the Adepta Sororitas superior to the common population housing of the Imperium? The cells are clean, regular, safe and uniform, yes, eliminating envy, status and other sins. Yet hive citizen might also consider them tedious, cold and punishing, compared to the exciting, if short life they experience in undercities, agronomic planets and hab blocks all over the galaxy…

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/Infantry
entry.value: Battle Chapel

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/InfantryDescription
entry.value: Building that produces infantry as well as increases population limit and generates requisitions.

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/InfantryFlavor
entry.value: The final stage of a novice’s career occurs in the Battle Chapel. Here, the cantus is trained in the use of her sacred weaponry—bolter, flamer, melta—and confirmed in her faith, proof against heresy. Normally, once trained, she would visit a primary Convent’s great hall for assignment to an Order—but on Gladius Prime, where no escape is possible, she enters straight into the ranks of her sistren, defending this world.

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/Influence
entry.value: Dialogus Scriptorium

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/InfluenceDescription
entry.value: Building that generates influence.

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/InfluenceFlavor
entry.value: It would be untrue to call the Dialogus order non-militant—no Battle Sister would accept that—but more true that their focus is away from physical and psychic warfare, and more on the psychological and faithful. In this Scriptorium, their speeches, prayers and inspirational sayings are transcribed, copied by auto-scribes and disseminated across Gladius Prime, to inspire the remaining population to keep surviving…

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/Loyalty
entry.value: Famulus Mission

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/LoyaltyDescription
entry.value: Building that increases loyalty.

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/LoyaltyFlavor
entry.value: Diplomacy and subtlety aren’t normally associated with the frothing fanatics of the Ecclesiarchy or the grim faith of the Battle Sisters—but those rare sisters who can charm and plot find themselves assigned to the Orders Famulus. They move with grace amongst the powerful of the Imperium, shifting their behaviour and breeding for the greater good of the Empire. Their extensive, regular connections with the Inquisition come in useful when they encounter… problems.

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/Requisitions
entry.value: Ministorum Depot

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/RequisitionsDescription
entry.value: Building that generates requisitions.

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/RequisitionsFlavor
entry.value: The Adepta Sororitas, though ultimately loyal to Terra, are supplied as much by their own networks as they are by the galaxy-spanning bureaucracy that is the Adeptus Administratum. Wherever their resources are brought from, though, they end up in the same place—the great echoing warehouses of a Ministorum depot.

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/Research
entry.value: Pronatus Reliquary

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/ResearchDescription
entry.value: Building that generates research.

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/ResearchFlavor
entry.value: Like the infamous Blood Ravens chapter or even the Necron Lord Trazyn the Infinite, the Adepta Sororitas Orders Pronatus are known for their hoarding tendencies. However, unlike the others, the Orders Pronatus are focused: their entire purpose is to gather, study and guard artefacts of value to the Ecclesiarchy. Whether a holy relic or a dangerous weapon, the Orders Pronatus will store it and guard it to the last Sister.

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/Vehicles
entry.value: Anointed Hangar

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/VehiclesDescription
entry.value: Building that produces ground vehicles as well as generates requisitions and research.

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/VehiclesFlavor
entry.value: The vehicles of the Adepta Sororitas are ancient—relic battle tanks of long-ago crusades. In this hangar, Exorcists, Castigators and Immolators have their machine spirits revived by the Ministorum technicians, are sprinkled with sacred oils, and sacred incantations handed down for thousands of years. To the T’au and Votann, this would be rank superstition—yet the machines work with a deadly efficiency.

entry.name: SpaceMarines/Aircraft
entry.value: Launch Pads

entry.name: SpaceMarines/AircraftDescription
entry.value: Building that produces aircraft as well as generates requisitions and influence.

entry.name: SpaceMarines/AircraftFlavor
entry.value: Staging area for the Chapter's aerial assault craft and transports, from whence battle-brothers may embark upon their endless crusade. The fortress-monastery's active gunships, interceptors, landing craft and even its mighty Thunderhawks are housed in a hive of hangars below the launch pads.

entry.name: SpaceMarines/Construction
entry.value: Orbital Relay

entry.name: SpaceMarines/ConstructionDescription
entry.value: Building that constructs new buildings and generates influence.

entry.name: SpaceMarines/ConstructionFlavor
entry.value: In normal times, the various Teleportaria would be used to transport troops to and from nearby starships. In these warptorn times, the Orbital Relay serves a more important function, communicating with the low-orbiting Battle Barge and calling down important requisitions for rapid surface deployment.

entry.name: SpaceMarines/EnergyDescription
entry.value: Building that generates energy.

entry.name: SpaceMarines/EnergyFlavor
entry.value: Though the light of the Emperor is the true source of every Chapter's strength, a physical power source is also required. The exact nature of its Generatorum differs from Chapter to Chapter. The Space Wolves, for instance, have driven immense crystal shafts deep into the surface of the planet Fenris, transforming subterranean heat into the endless energy their fortress-monastery demands.

entry.name: SpaceMarines/GeneseedBunker
entry.value: Geneseed Bunker

entry.name: SpaceMarines/GeneseedBunkerDescription
entry.value: Building that stores the geneseed of your chapter and generates influence.

entry.name: SpaceMarines/GeneseedBunkerFlavor
entry.value: Using all of the secrets of the machine spirits, Techmarines have designed these bunkers to be shielded in every possible way—physically, electromagnetically and psychically. It will take the labour of hundreds of heavy Servitors, but even if a Chapter's warriors die to a man, the Apothecaries and geneseed in these bunkers will be able to resurrect it… eventually.

entry.name: SpaceMarines/Headquarters
entry.value: Great Hall

entry.name: SpaceMarines/HeadquartersDescription
entry.value: Headquarters building that generates resources.

entry.name: SpaceMarines/HeadquartersFlavor
entry.value: Every fortress-monastery contains myriad halls large enough to house several armies, but most have too a Great Hall, centerpiece of a Chapter's home. Trophies, relics and even its most revered spacecraft may be housed within the Great Hall. If the sight of the Great Hall does not reduce a visitor to dumbfounded silence, then it has failed in its purpose.

entry.name: SpaceMarines/HeroesDescription
entry.value: Building that produces heroes as well as generates influence and increases loyalty.

entry.name: SpaceMarines/HeroesFlavor
entry.value: For those rare ceremonies that require the attendance of every Battle Brother, the vastness of the Reclusiam allows the entire Chapter to gather. This is the most precious place in a fortress-monastery—home to its most sacred relics and, in a rare few, the very body of its Primarch. It is also the seat of the chapter's commanders and heroes.

entry.name: SpaceMarines/HousingDescription
entry.value: Building that increases population limit.

entry.name: SpaceMarines/HousingFlavor
entry.value: Though each Battle-Brother receives his own personal cell, those members of a Chapter who do not directly enforce the will of the Emperor share communal quarters spread across the fortress-monastery. Support staff including servants, nurses and technicians call these stark dormitories home.

entry.name: SpaceMarines/InfantryDescription
entry.value: Building that produces infantry as well as increases population limit and generates research.

entry.name: SpaceMarines/InfantryFlavor
entry.value: The Apothecarion provides medical support for wounded Battle-Brothers, and plays a vital role in the elevation of an Aspirant to a Space Marine. Both these functions pale into insignificance against the Apothecarion's other purpose—the preservation of its Chapter's unique gene-seed, from which new Space Marines are created. If the gene-seed is lost, so too is the Chapter.

entry.name: SpaceMarines/InfluenceDescription
entry.value: Building that generates influence.

entry.name: SpaceMarines/InfluenceFlavor
entry.value: An immense and high-ceilinged gathering-place, wherein every member of the Chapter may assemble to attend briefings, ceremonies and even feasts of particular import. In most fortress-monasteries, the Great Hall is the only room to exceed the sheer size of the Assimularum.

entry.name: SpaceMarines/Loyalty
entry.value: Company Chapel

entry.name: SpaceMarines/LoyaltyDescription
entry.value: Building that increases loyalty.

entry.name: SpaceMarines/LoyaltyFlavor
entry.value: Here the Chaplains tend to the spiritual well-being of their charges, ensuring the discipline of every Marine and keeping their minds and spirits pure. In order to accommodate this, each of the Chapter's ten Companies has its own dedicated chapel. Greater ceremonies take place in the Reclusiam itself.

entry.name: SpaceMarines/RequisitionsDescription
entry.value: Building that generates requisitions.

entry.name: SpaceMarines/RequisitionsFlavor
entry.value: The Chapter's mammoth dining halls and kitchens are contained within its Refectories. The Space Marine diet is a spartan affair, augmented with a cocktail of bio-chemical supplements to ensure constant battle-readiness. The Battle-Brothers consume this repast in complete silence.

entry.name: SpaceMarines/ResearchDescription
entry.value: Building that generates research.

entry.name: SpaceMarines/ResearchFlavor
entry.value: Though also a store for extensive written histories of its Chapter, the Librarium is first and foremost its central command, communications and defence station. Here, Astropaths manage external and intra-base comms, while Librarians and psykers pore over, protect and update the Chapter's centuries of wisdom.

entry.name: SpaceMarines/VehiclesDescription
entry.value: Building that produces ground vehicles as well as generates requisitions and research.

entry.name: SpaceMarines/VehiclesFlavor
entry.value: Home to anything that a Marine might employ to purge the battlefield of xenos and heretics, from the simplest combat knife to the most redoubtable of relics. The Master of Ordnance keeps a close watch upon the Chapter's wargear—only his gene-print can grant access to this titanic underground repository of weapons and vehicles.

entry.name: Tau/Aircraft
entry.value: Kor'vattra Nacelle

entry.name: Tau/AircraftDescription
entry.value: Building that produces aircraft as well as increases population limit and generates influence.

entry.name: Tau/AircraftFlavor
entry.value: The Air Caste’s slender limbs and hollow bones are so ill-suited to life on the ground that they are often called ‘The Invisible Caste’ by planet-dwellers. Their nacelles are combined factories, hangars and living spaces—throughout holding technology that reduces the effects of Gladius Prime’s gravity on their delicate physiology.

entry.name: Tau/Construction
entry.value: Brachyuran'm Foundry

entry.name: Tau/ConstructionDescription
entry.value: Building that constructs new buildings as well as generates ore, research and influence.

entry.name: Tau/ConstructionFlavor
entry.value: The Brachyuran might not be suited to combat—after all, they mostly closely resemble crustaceans similar to tiny Terran crabs—but their compact form conceals a fierce technical intelligence, ideally suited to delicate construction. In this foundry, teams of Brachyuran can aid the Earth Caste in building structures, from the macro to the micro level.

entry.name: Tau/Energy
entry.value: Sho'aun'or'es Plant

entry.name: Tau/EnergyDescription
entry.value: Building that generates energy.

entry.name: Tau/EnergyFlavor
entry.value: The Demiurg were the first to lend the T’au their expertise, but the T’au have also drawn upon the abandoned technology of the Imperium, refining it in their way. This strange structure reflects that mixed origin, showing T’au aesthetics imposed on an Imperial reactor cluster.

entry.name: Tau/Food
entry.value: P'greet'an Hydroponics

entry.name: Tau/FoodDescription
entry.value: Building that harvests food.

entry.name: Tau/FoodFlavor
entry.value: Many races have joined the T’au, but not all have some unique skillset. The Greet are an aquatic race, undistinguished in most fields; all they can contribute to the T’au is their labour and knowledge of aquaculture in these sealed hydroponic farms.

entry.name: Tau/Loyalty
entry.value: Ta'aun Totem

entry.name: Tau/LoyaltyDescription
entry.value: Building that increases loyalty.

entry.name: Tau/LoyaltyFlavor
entry.value: This is a simple statue to Aun’Va, the Ethereal Supreme, showing him supporting the way, sculpted as a portal through which all the races of the galaxy flow. Embedded in its bone-white surface are a range of listening devices, to track the sentiment of the population and isolate dissident elements.

entry.name: Tau/Headquarters
entry.value: Tau'shiro HQ

entry.name: Tau/HeadquartersDescription
entry.value: Headquarters building that generates resources.

entry.name: Tau/HeadquartersFlavor
entry.value: Named after the Air Caste’s continent-sized space stations, this fortress acts as the central point of the colony-city. It is theoretically the solitary preserve of the Commanders in a military situation, but in practice is the seat of the colony’s Ethereals.

entry.name: Tau/Heroes
entry.value: Shan'ar'tol Stasis

entry.name: Tau/HeroesDescription
entry.value: Building that produces heroes as well as generates food and influence.

entry.name: Tau/HeroesFlavor
entry.value: Commanders like ShadowSun and PureTide are rare individuals, raised up by the Ethereals to be representatives of all that is good and true about the T’au. So few are they that, when not deployed on campaigns, they are placed in stasis until the next time they are needed.

entry.name: Tau/Housing
entry.value: Tio'ur'm Pods

entry.name: Tau/HousingDescription
entry.value: Building that increases population limit.

entry.name: Tau/HousingFlavor
entry.value: These sturdy housing units shelter the T’au’s greatest resource—its population of T’au and general workers. It is often the best-defended location next to the Ethereals—because without workers and families to survive and rebuild, where is the worth in fighting?

entry.name: Tau/Infantry
entry.value: Shas'm Barracks

entry.name: Tau/InfantryDescription
entry.value: Building that produces infantry as well as increases population limit and generates influence.

entry.name: Tau/InfantryFlavor
entry.value: In this smooth-skinned blister-bunker, Fireblades and other T’au veterans train up the members of the fire caste from Shas’saal recruits into full-blown Shas’la Fire Warriors, administering the Trial of Fire at the end of their fourth year.

entry.name: Tau/Influence
entry.value: Por'sral Broadcaster

entry.name: Tau/InfluenceDescription
entry.value: Building that generates influence.

entry.name: Tau/InfluenceFlavor
entry.value: The Water Caste are diplomats-supreme—able to talk round the most intransigent, alien species to the T’au—but on hostile Gladius, their skills are best employed in this lean communications tower proselytising on all channels, attracting the remaining population to the cause.

entry.name: Tau/MonstrousCreatures
entry.value: Xar'vesa Crisis Centre

entry.name: Tau/MonstrousCreaturesDescription
entry.value: Building that produces monstrous creatures as well as generates research and influence.

entry.name: Tau/MonstrousCreaturesFlavor
entry.value: Once a Fire Warrior has passed their Trial-By-Fire and proven themself, they are allowed to don the Her'ex'evre or Mantle of Heroes and pilot a battlesuit. Here, the iconic T’au machines are assembled by the Earth Caste, with Brachyuran technicians working on the fine internal mechanisms.

entry.name: Tau/Ore
entry.value: Anthrazod'm Refinery

entry.name: Tau/OreDescription
entry.value: Building that harvests ore.

entry.name: Tau/OreFlavor
entry.value: A sturdy Xenos species, the Anthrazods normally spend their lives mining asteroids for the greater good. The shortage of manpower—and lack of asteroids—on Gladius means they’re working more closely with the Earth Caste to extract and refine ore.

entry.name: Tau/Research
entry.value: Bentu'sin Lab

entry.name: Tau/ResearchDescription
entry.value: Building that generates research.

entry.name: Tau/ResearchFlavor
entry.value: The squat race that the Imperium knows as the Demiurg are called the ‘wise-gifted ones’ or Bentusi by the T’au, for their mastery of advanced science and automation. They are normally a semi-allied space-bound race, but on Gladius they have been forced to the ground, where they dole out their advanced technology to the T’au grudgingly.

entry.name: Tau/Vehicles
entry.value: Fio'xar Arsenal

entry.name: Tau/VehiclesDescription
entry.value: Building that produces ground vehicles as well as generates ore and influence.

entry.name: Tau/VehiclesFlavor
entry.value: Here the dour Earth caste craft the unique skimmer vehicles available to the T’au military. Over time, they assure you, they will be able to increase their capabilities.

entry.name: Tyranids/Aircraft
entry.value: Capillary Tower

entry.name: Tyranids/AircraftDescription
entry.value: Building that produces flying monstrous creatures and generates research as well as increases the loyalty and population limit.

entry.name: Tyranids/AircraftFlavor
entry.value: Tall as a human Hive City, Capillary Towers are the backbone of Tyranid conquest. Here, the resources of the planet are siphoned from Reclamation Pools and fed up through the troposphere to meet the umbilical tongues of orbiting Hive ships. On Gladius, the Towers have no Hive Ships to feed. Instead, Gargoyles and Hive Crones crawl from birthing sacs on the Tower's sides and wait for their newborn wings to stiffen so they can join the war.

entry.name: Tyranids/Biomass
entry.value: Reclamation Pool

entry.name: Tyranids/BiomassDescription
entry.value: Building that generates biomass.

entry.name: Tyranids/BiomassFlavor
entry.value: A Reclamation Pool is one of the core structures of a Tyranid invasion, a wide bubbling cartilaginous pit bubbling with acids and enzymes. Irrespective of the war raging around it, the Hive's swarming rippers bring collected biomass to the Reclamation Pool where it is dissolved. In a normal situation, it would be fed through Capillary Towers up to the waiting Hive Fleet; on Gladius, the biomass is stored or used in the creation of more troops.

entry.name: Tyranids/Construction
entry.value: Megafauna Sac

entry.name: Tyranids/ConstructionDescription
entry.value: Building that constructs new buildings as well as generates biomass and increases the population limit.

entry.name: Tyranids/ConstructionFlavor
entry.value: Nothing reflects the inhumanity of a hive more than the Megafauna Sac. To a human eye, its smooth membranous dome is reminiscent of a design for a museum. However, when it tears itself asunder to reveal another giant biostructure, pulsating and screaming in its birth throes—when that building is half-dragged, half-crawls its towering flesh into position—when the Sac gums itself back together and ripper swarms consume its afterbirth—the human mind then sees it as truly alien.

entry.name: Tyranids/Headquarters
entry.value: Norn Cyst

entry.name: Tyranids/HeadquartersDescription
entry.value: Headquarters building that generates resources.

entry.name: Tyranids/HeadquartersFlavor
entry.value: The organising organism of a Tyranid's hive, the Norn Cyst is always the first biostructure to be placed. The Malanthrope places the hive in a suitable location and tends its exponential growth as the hive manages and defends any connected biostructures. When the hive's use has passed, the Malanthrope strips the Cyst's living connections and carries to a new source of biomass. The remaining redundant structure sloughs itself back into the nearest reclamation pool. Soon, the hive is completely gone.

entry.name: Tyranids/Heroes
entry.value: Alpha Ovipository

entry.name: Tyranids/HeroesDescription
entry.value: Building that produces heroes as well as generates biomass and increases loyalty.

entry.name: Tyranids/HeroesFlavor
entry.value: Whilst the Anthropia emerge solely from the Aedanthropum's long-gestation sacs, the most complex synapse creatures take even more of the Hive Mind's resources and, crucially, focus. Each Tyrant, Tervigon and Prime requires careful design from the Mind, to give it that balance between total control and useful independence. The concentrated sensoria of the Ovipository enable that focus.

entry.name: Tyranids/Housing
entry.value: Hibernation Marsupia

entry.name: Tyranids/HousingDescription
entry.value: Building that increases population limit.

entry.name: Tyranids/HousingFlavor
entry.value: Excess biomass and genetic data are simply stored in the thickened walls of the biostructures or flow twitching between them. But when a creature has been grown, sometimes the Hive Mind deems it more efficient to retain it but shut down its functions, stored in serried ranks of marsupia.

entry.name: Tyranids/Infantry
entry.value: Brood Nest

entry.name: Tyranids/InfantryDescription
entry.value: Building that produces infantry and beasts as well as generates biomass and increases loyalty.

entry.name: Tyranids/InfantryFlavor
entry.value: While a Norn Queen normally produces all the creatures of a Tyranid invasion, in the circumstances that a brood is physically isolated from the Hive Fleet, certain specialised structures are used. Smaller creatures like Termagants are gestated in the pods of this nest, fed and warmed by the unthinking structures.

entry.name: Tyranids/Influence
entry.value: Synapse Node

entry.name: Tyranids/InfluenceDescription
entry.value: Building that generates influence.

entry.name: Tyranids/InfluenceFlavor
entry.value: The Hive Mind's capabilities aren't spread evenly throughout its structures—somewhere, there needs to be concentrated systems for thought. In the Hive Fleet, these are the Norn Queens. On the ground, these synapses act as temporary back-ups to the network effect from its individual creatures, allowing the Mind to focus on more objectives than simply controlling the swarm.

entry.name: Tyranids/Loyalty
entry.value: Coherence Node

entry.name: Tyranids/LoyaltyDescription
entry.value: Building that increases loyalty.

entry.name: Tyranids/LoyaltyFlavor
entry.value: An Imperial scholar, might make an analogy between a coherence node and something like a radio tower—and, certainly, it's orchid-ear appearance fits—but it doesn't transmit but receives. The node's folded surfaces track the locations of the Hive Mind's creatures for the most efficient deployment of its synapses, to prevent the Hive swarms falling into anarchy and chaos.

entry.name: Tyranids/Research
entry.value: Genetic Epicure

entry.name: Tyranids/ResearchDescription
entry.value: Building that generates research.

entry.name: Tyranids/ResearchFlavor
entry.value: Though the Malanthropes are responsible for physically collecting genetic data from a planet's population, the Epicure is the structure that processes those samples. Inside the Epicure's fluted mass, delicate structures pare and sort the genetic samples, testing them on a microscopic scale for useful innovations. When something is discovered, it is immediately communicated to the Norn Cyst and hence onto the Hive Mind.

entry.name: Tyranids/ThropesDescription
entry.value: Building that produces Thropes and generates research.

entry.name: Tyranids/ThropesFlavor
entry.value: Not all Tyranid creatures are equal; whilst Termagants and Hormagaunts require little focus and unspecialised resources, the construction and gestation of more complex creatures can take more care. In isolated hives like that of Gladius, the diverse support creatures the Imperium calls Anthropia—Venomthropes, Zoanthropes and Malanthropes—all emerge from a specialised biostructure of gristly columns, podia and caverns.

entry.name: Tyranids/Vehicles
entry.value: Brood Haunt

entry.name: Tyranids/VehiclesDescription
entry.value: Building that produces ground-based monstrous creatures and generates biomass.

entry.name: Tyranids/VehiclesFlavor
entry.value: Some of the Hive Mind's creations are produced by separate biostructures because of the care and resources taken in their rendering. Others are simply large. The Brood Haunt houses those brutish giants that are far too big for the Brood Nest. Inside this high-spined haunt, womb-caverns of bone filled with suspensory fluid allow the layering of muscle and bone for these monstrous giants.
